borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <p style="text-align:justify"><span style="font-size:11pt"><span style="font-family:Arial,sans-serif">The proposed development,&nbsp;by reason of its poor architectural quality, design, appearance and lack of presence within the street scene results in the conversion and extension appearing discordant and further fails to respect the host and neighbouring dwellings. The development will provide undersized internal amenity spaces, detrimental&nbsp;to the living conditions of future residents, resulting in a poorly designed outbuilding akin to a bed in a shed, contrary to:&nbsp;</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span style="font-size:11pt"><span style="background-attachment:initial; background-clip:initial; background-image:initial; background-origin:initial; background-position:initial; background-repeat:initial; background-size:initial">- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019)<br>- Policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (March 2016)<br>- Policies D1 and D4 of the Draft London Plan (December 2019)<br>- Policy CP3 of the Core Strategy DPD (July 2010)<br>- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Borough Wide DPD (March 2011)<br>- Policies SP2, DMD1, DMNE3 and DMD6 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Consultation version, October&nbsp;2020).<br>- Residential Extensions and Alterations SPD (February 2012)<br>- Technical housing standards - nationally described space standard (March 2015)</span></span></p>
description: Conversion of the garage, including a single storey side extension, to provide habitable accommodation for 63 Manor Road as a Annexe.
